page.title: 03 Religion
page.content: The main Christian Denominations in Attleborough are Church of England, Methodists,Baptists and Christian Brethren(Free Evangelicals)who all have their own premises;Roman Catholics who, rather unusually, share the use of the Parish Church; Society of Friends('Quakers'), Salvation Army and Seventh-Day Adventists who meet in nearby towns, (such as East Harling,Diss or Norwich) although the Salvation Army had premises in the town until the 1970's. There is a small body of Jehovah's Witnesses carrying out their usual evangelical activities in the town,but meeting elsewhere.There is no significant immigrant religion.Church membership is generally increasing,but not in proportion to the growth of the town,though it appears that about half of the children born into the town are
